content:
# We have successfully gathered 10 more units of copper ore, bringing our inventory to 10 copper ore, along with 5 iron ore, 10 coal, and 5 stone.
# The copper furnace has produced a total of 10 copper plates, but it still has 4 units of copper ore left to process.

# Now, let's insert the copper ore into the copper furnace to continue producing copper plates.
insert_item(Prototype.CopperOre, furnace_copper, quantity=10)  # Insert all gathered copper ore into the copper furnace

# After inserting the copper ore, we will check the inventory before monitoring the furnace for production.
print(f"Final Inventory: {inspect_inventory()} after adding copper ore to the furnace.")  # Check inventory after inserting

# Now, we will monitor the copper furnace for a maximum of 30 seconds to see if more copper plates are produced.
for _ in range(30):  # Maximum wait time for smelting
    if inspect_inventory(furnace_copper)[Prototype.CopperPlate] >= 2:  # Check if we have produced at least 2 new copper plates
        break
    sleep(1)
else:
    raise Exception("Copper smelting timeout - check inputs.")

# Finally, we will check the inventory and status of the entities after the smelting attempt of copper plates.
print(f"Final Inventory: {inspect_inventory()} after attempting to smelt copper plates.")  # Final inventory check
print(f"Entities on the map: {get_entities()} after production status.")  # Check entity status again.
